description: The `Code Structure & Clustering` subsystem is responsible for analyzing the structural relationships within the codebase. Its primary function is to construct and manage call graphs, identify logical groupings of code (clusters), and offer utilities to leverage these structural insights for further analysis or documentation generation.

components.name: Call Graph Analysis
components.description: This component is dedicated to extracting and representing method invocation data, thereby constructing a comprehensive call graph of the project. It provides the foundational data necessary to understand execution flow and dependencies between different code entities.

components.name: Code Clustering
components.description: This component takes the structural data, primarily from the Call Graph Analysis, to group related methods or classes into cohesive clusters. Its goal is to identify logical modules and improve the understanding of the high-level organization and modularity of the codebase.
